Get Smart

From memory cards to antennas, almost every smartphone contains more than 20 Molex connectors.

 
 

Have You Heard?

Molex has thousands of connectors being used in important medical devices around the world including Molex Temp-Flex® MediSpec™ Micro Extrusion Primary Wires for cochlear implants. Hearing aids just make the sound louder, but cochlear implants with Molex technology directly stimulate the auditory nerve using electrical signals.

 

In 2017, Koch Industries acquired Guardian Industries. Along with being a leading manufacturer of high performance glass that dramatically reduces energy usage and increases comfort in buildings, Guardian also produces high-value coatings on plastics for transportation and distributes specialty building products. The company began as a small windshield fabricator in Detroit, Michigan, in 1932. Since then, Guardian has grown to 17,000 people across five continents.

 

And the Emmy® goes to...

In 2008, Molex receives an Emmy® Award for its interconnect and cable system contributions to HDMI technology.

 
 

Shining Bright

Molex’s Transcend® Versatile Lighting Module (VLM) is illuminating new ways to build state-of-the-art lighting ambiance. By delivering open source, low-voltage LED lighting, manufacturers now have maximum flexibility in aesthetic and output options.
